title: Can we Withdraw after accepting seat in Round 1
content:
Quick Question:

Can we withdraw from PES after accepting a seat either in Round 1 or 2?

What are the charges associated with it ?

And the procedure?

May or may not get either in CET or COMEDK, hence the query. 

Appreciate guidance

comments.body:
If you take a seat in round 1, and then come to round 2, you have to take *some* seat. So if you get a better seat you can upgrade, but if you don't get a better seat **you will be stuck with your seat from round 1**. On the other hand, if you take a seat in round 1 and choose not to come to round 2, you can withdraw the seat as well - for a fee.

This used to be the policy until a few years ago, confirm with a current first year to be safe.
If you withdraw a seat before second round you had to pay the counseling fees (10k for my batch ). If you get a seat through KCET the fees is adjusted accordingly.
